com.dhemery.expressing
Class ImmediateExpressions

java.lang.Object
  com.dhemery.expressing.ImmediateExpressions
Direct Known Subclasses:
Expressive
public class ImmediateExpressions
extends Object

Composed assertions and evaluations, and syntactic sugar for use with Expressive. In contrast to the methods in other Expressiveâ€“related classes, these methods evaluate expressions immediately, without polling. These methods are all declared static, so they can be used without instantiating an Expressive.

Method Detail

assertThat

public static void assertThat(Condition condition)
Assert that the condition is true.

Example:

 Condition lifeIsButADream = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(lifeIsButADream);

assertThat

public static <V> void assertThat(Sampler<V> variable,
                                  org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
Assert that a sample of the variable satisfies the criteria.

Example:

 Sampler<Integer> threadCount = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(threadCount, is(9));

assertThat

public static void assertThat(Sampler<Boolean> variable)
Assert that a sample of the variable is true.

Example:

 Sampler<Boolean> theresAFlyInMySoup = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(theresAFlyInMySoup);

assertThat

public static <S,V> void assertThat(S subject,
                                    Feature<? super S,V> feature,
                                    org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
Assert that a sample of the feature satisfies the criteria.

Example:

 TextField userNameField = ...;
 Feature<TextField,Color> textColor() { ... }
 Matcher<Color> blue() { ... }
 ...
 assertThat(userNameField, textColor(), is(blue()));

assertThat

public static <S> void assertThat(S subject,
                                  Feature<? super S,Boolean> feature)
Assert that a sample of the feature is true.

Example:

 Page settingsPage = ...;
 Feature<Page,Boolean> displayed() { ... }
 ...
 assertThat(settingsPage, is(displayed()));
